sourcesContent:
export const questionObj = {"Qtext": "
 In the below figure, ABC is a right-angled triangle with \(\angle\) BAC = 90\degree.\\
 (i) Prove that \(\Delta\)ADB \(\sim\) \(\Delta\)CDA.\\
 (ii) If BD = 100 cm and CD = 64 cm, find AD.\\
 (iii) Find the ratio of area of triangles ADB and CDA.\\
 \begin{center}
 tikzpicture{}
 \end{center} 
", "Steps": [{"id": "s1", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "
 (i) Since, $$\angle ADB = 90\degree = \angle ADC$$.\\
 $$\angle C + \angle CAD = 90\degree$$\\
 Also, $$\angle DAB + \angle CAD = 90\degree = \angle A$$\\
 $$\angle DAB + \angle CAD = \angle C + \angle CAD$$ \\
 $$\angle DAB = \angle C$$\\
 In $$\Delta ADB$$ and $$\Delta CDA$$\\
 $$\angle ADB = \angle ADC$$ and $$\angle DAB = \angle C$\\
 So, $$\Delta ADB \sim \Delta CDA$$\\
 (ii) Since, $$\Delta ADB \sim \Delta CDA$$\\
 $\dfrac{BD}{AD} = \dfrac{AD}{CD} \Rightarrow {AD}^2 = BD \times CD$\\
 $\Rightarrow {AD}^2 = 100 \times 64$\\
 $\Rightarrow AD = 80 cm.$\\
 (iii) As the triangle is Similar, the ratio of their area is equal to ratio of square of their any two corresponding sides.\\
 Since, $\Delta$ADB $\sim$ $\Delta$CDA\\
 $\dfrac{area of \Delta ADB}{area of \Delta CDA} = \dfrac{{BD}^2}{{AD}^2} = \left(\dfrac{BD}{AD}\right)^2 = \left(\dfrac{100}{80}\right)^2$\\
 $\Rightarrow$ area of $\Delta$ADB : area of $\Delta$CDA = 25 : 16.\\ 
"}]} 

 export const resp = [{"data": [], "text": " "}]
